intro: Hibbertia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia uncinata has hairy stems and lobed leaves, and it produces small, hooked fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It is a hardy species that thrives in well-drained environments and is often used in native gardens.
